page.title: 13EDUCATION in Withington
page.content: There are about 70 children under the age of 16 in the Lower Withington area. The{primary school}in Withington village has closed and approximatly 30 children travel to the primary school in Marton, a small village 2\ miles away. Children over 11 years old attend either Holmes Chapel {Comprehensive School}or Dane Valley High School in Congleton, also comprehensive. Free coach transport is provided by Cheshire County Council to Marton and Dane Valley and the majority attend these two schools. A number of children attend{private } {schools}in Alderley Edge, Macclesfield, Cheadle Hulme and near Jodrell Bank.
